LABEL: mineral salt vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that is formed as a mineral salt.

LABEL: microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that contains microbial derived material.

LABEL: aluminum hydroxide vaccine adjuvant
definition: An aluminum vaccine adjuvant that contains aluminum hydroxide.

LABEL: aluminum phosphate vaccine adjuvant
definition: An aluminum vaccine adjuvant that is aluminum phosphate.

LABEL: calcium phosphate vaccine adjuvant
definition: A mineral salt vaccine adjuvant composed of calcium phosphate.

LABEL: Freund's emulsified oil adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant that consists of a water-in-oil emulsion of aqueous antigen in paraffin (mineral) oil of low specific gravity and low viscosity. It is named after Jules T. Freund (1890-1960), Hungarian-born American immunologist. It is a water in oil emulsion.

LABEL: complete Freund's adjuvant
definition: A Freund's emulsified oil adjuvant that contains inactivated and dried mycobacteria, usually Mycobacterium tuberculosis (the pathogenic agent of tuberculosis).

LABEL: incomplete Freund's adjuvant
definition: A Freund's emulsified oil adjuvant that does not contain the mycobacterial components.

LABEL: cholera toxin vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant consisting of cholera toxin (CT) from Vibrio cholerae.

LABEL: Corynebacterium-derived P40 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant that is the P40 particulate fraction isolated from Corynebacterium.

LABEL: lipopolysaccharide vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant made from bacterial lipopolysaccharide (LPS) of gram-negative bacteria.

LABEL: muramyl dipeptide vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant formulated to correspond to a component found in a water-soluble extract of cell walls of mycobacteria used in complete Freund's adjuvant (CFA).

LABEL: squalene vacccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant that contains an organic polymer with some antigenic epitopes which might be shared with other organic polymers acting as immunostimulators.

LABEL: arlacel A vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is an emulsifier called Arlacel A.

LABEL: Montanide 103 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A Montanide vaccine adjuvant that is Montanide 103.

LABEL: Bordetella pertussis component vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivitive vaccine adjuvant that contains components from killed Bordetella pertussis. The killed B. pertussis has a strong adjuvant effect on the diphtheria and tetanus toxoids in the DPT vaccines.

LABEL: Adjumer vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is PCPP salt.

LABEL: liposome-based vaccine adjuvant
Parent: particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant
definition: A particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant that contains particles made up of concentric lipid membranes containing phospholipids and other lipids in a bilayer configuration separated by aqueous compartments. It is a relatively stable but non-covalently-bound complex of saponin adjuvant Quil-A, cholesterol and amphipathic antigen in a molar ratio of approximately 1:1:1. The spectrum of viral capsid antigens and non-viral amphipathic antigens of relevance for human vaccination, incorporated into ISCOMs, comprises influenza, measles, rabies, gp340 from EB-virus, gp120 from HIV, Plasmodium falciparum and Trypanosoma cruzi.

LABEL: E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant that is derived from E. coli heat labile toxin LT.

LABEL: adamantylamide dipeptide vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant, adamantylamide dipeptide (AdDP) is the desmuramyl analog of MDP.

LABEL: vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine component is a chemical substance added to a vaccine to enhance and direct the immune response to a protective antigen. Vaccine adjuvants may cause a range of serious side-effects.
equivalent axioms: ('vaccine component' and 'has role' some 'vaccine adjuvant role')

LABEL: ISCOM vaccine adjuvant
Parent: particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant
definition: A particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant that consists of an assembly of antigens in multimeric form and presents an antigen to induce specific immunologic responses. The assembly is attached to a matrix with a built-in adjuvant, saponin. ISCOMs induce strong serum antibody responses, and are used as highly immunogenic forms of subunit vaccines. MeSH term: D20.215.894.860.449.

LABEL: aluminum vaccine adjuvant
definition: A mineral salt vaccine adjuvant that is composed of some aluminum compound.

LABEL: xanthan gum vaccine ajuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is derived from Xanthomonas campestris, has a pentasaccharide repeating unit structure, and its terminus contains a mannose moiety which acts as a toll-like receptor 2 agonist.

LABEL: IL-12 vacince adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that contains IL-12.

LABEL: CpG DNA vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant compsed of CpG DNA.

LABEL: Ribi vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant that is a stable oil-in-water emulsion.

LABEL: RC529 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant named RC529 that is a lipid A mimetic.

LABEL: aluminum potassium sulfate adjuvant
definition: An aluminum vaccine adjuvant that is aluminum potassium sulfate (AlK(SO4)2).

LABEL: Alhydrogel vaccine adjuvant
definition: An aluminum hydroxide vaccine adjuvant that is a gel that is made by precipitation of aluminum hydroxide Al(OH)3 under alkaline conditions.

LABEL: cholera toxin B subunit vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cholera toxin derived vaccine adjuvant made of the B subunit of the cholera toxin from Vibrio cholerae.

LABEL: RC529-AF vaccine adjuvant
alternative label: RC529 vaccine adjuvant in an aqueour formulation
definition: An aqueous formula of the synthetic vaccine adjuvant RC529.
editor note: RC529-AF can be obtained from Corixa Corporation (Seattle, WA).

LABEL: monophosphoryl lipid A vaccine adjuvant
alternative label: 3-O-deacylated monophosphoryl lipid A vaccine adjuvant|3D-MLA|MPL vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant derived from the lipopolysaccharide (LPS) of Salmonella minnesota R595.

LABEL: LTK63 vaccine mutant
Parent: E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant
definition: An E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant that is a mutant form of LT containing a Ser-Lys substitution in position 63 which has been shown to be totally devoid of toxicity stable to protease treatment and able to act as mucosal adjuvant.
editor note: LTK63 is an enzymatically inactive mutant of the heat-labile enterotoxin of Escherichia coli. It can be used as a potent mucosal adjuvant.

LABEL: killed Corynebacterium parvum vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant derived from heat-killed Corynebacterium parvum.

LABEL: Titermax Gold vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant which is a water-in-oil adjuvant with CRL-8300 (a block copolymer), squalene, and sorbitan monooleate.

LABEL: DDA vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is dimethyldioctadecylammonium bromide (DDA), a lipophilic quaternary ammonium salt known as a good adjuvant when co-administered systemically or nasally with an antigen.

LABEL: cationic liposomal vaccine adjuvant DDA:TDB
definition: A liposome-based vaccine adjuvant that have a positive surface charge.

LABEL: QuilA vaccine adjuvant
definition: A tenosactive compound vaccine adjuvant that contains purified extract from the bark of the South American tree Quillaja saponaria Molina.

LABEL: AS02 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A combination vaccine adjuvant comprised of monophosphoryl lipid A (MPL), QS21 and an oil in water emulsion.
editor note: monophosphoryl lipid A (MPL), QS21 and an oil in water emulsion.

LABEL: AS04 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A combination vaccine adjuvant that is a combination of 50 ug of the immunoenhancer MPL (3-O-desacyl-4′-monophosphoryl lipid A) with 500 ug of aluminium salt.

LABEL: VSA-3 vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant which is an emulsion plus DDA.

LABEL: saponin vaccine adjuvant
definition: A tensoactive compound vaccine adjuvant that is derived from saponin, a compound that is an immunostimulator found in the plant P. senega.

LABEL: Montanide ISA 720 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A Montanide vaccine adjuvant that is formulated as water-in-oil emulsions and induces high antibody titers in several animal species. It is a vaccine adjuvant composed of metabolizable oil and a surfactant system designed to make a water-in-oil emulsion. It has been used since 1992 in more than 50 clinical trials related to therapeutic vaccines against various diseases such as cancer and malaria.

LABEL: Montanide incomplete Seppic adjuvant
definition: A Montanide vaccine adjuvant that is a mineral oil adjuvant.

LABEL: Montanide ISA51 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A Montanide vaccine adjuvant that is a vaccine adjuvant composed of a light mineral oil and a surfactant system designed to make a water-in-oil emulsion.

LABEL: Montanide vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant developed by Montanide.

LABEL: EtxB vaccine adjuvant
Parent: E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant
alternative label: B subunit of E. coli heat-labile enterotoxin
definition: An E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant composed of the B subunit of E. coli heat-labile toxin.

LABEL: Polygen vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant with the tradename Polygen.

LABEL: Algal Glucan vaccine adjuvant
definition: A carbohydrate vaccine adjuvant, which enhances both humoral and cell-mediated immunity to oligopeptides in experimental animal models.

LABEL: Algammulin vaccine adjuvant
definition: A combination vaccine adjuvant that suspension of 1-2um ovoids of immune stimulant gamma inulin (g-IN) in which alum is embedded as a carrier for protein or other anionic antigens.

LABEL: BAY R1005 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is Bay R1005 (N-(2-Deoxy-2-L-leucylamino beta-D-glucopyranosyl)-N-octadecyldodecanoylamide hydroacetate ).

LABEL: Avridine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is N, N-dioctadecyl-N', N'-bis(2-hydroxyethyl) propanediamine (Avridine).

LABEL: calcium phosphate gel vaccine adjuvant
definition: A calcium phosphate vaccine adjuvant that is a gel prepared by precipitating soluable calcium and phosphate salts.

LABEL: cholera toxin A1-subunit-ProteinA D-fragment fusion protein
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant composed of the CTA1-DD fusion protein.

LABEL: DOC/Alum Complex vaccine adjuvant
definition: A mineral salt vaccine adjuvant that is composed of Deoxycholic acid sodium salt (DOC) complexed with aluminum hydroxide.

LABEL: gamma Inulin vaccine adjuvant
definition: A carbohydrate adjuvant that is a highly specific activator of the alternative pathway of complement in vitro and in vivo, and is composed of linear (unbranched) b-D-(2-1) polyfructofuranosyl-a-D-glucose.

LABEL: Gerbu vaccine adjuvant
definition: A combination vaccine adjuvant that is comprised of a mixture of GMDP, DDA, and Zinc L-proline salt complex (ZnPro8).

LABEL: GM-CSF vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that includes GM-CSF.

LABEL: GMDP vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant containing GMDP, a higly effective primary adjuvant.

LABEL: recombinant hIFN-gamma/Interferon-g vaccine adjuvant
definition: An IFN-gamma vaccine adjuvant that is composed of recombinant hIFN-gamma.

LABEL: interleukin-1b vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that includes IL-1b.

LABEL: interleukin-2 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that includes IL-2.

LABEL: interleukin-7 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that includes IL-7.

LABEL: Loxoribine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that includes loxoribine which is a guanosine analog derivatized at position N7 and C8, and activates TLR-7.

LABEL: MF59 vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant consisting of an oil (squalene)-in-water nano emulsion.

LABEL: MTP-PE Liposomes vaccine adjuvant
definition: A liposome-based vaccine adjuvant that consists of liposomes containing  the synthetic lipophilic analog of muramyl dipeptide, muramyl tripeptide phosphatidylethanolamine (MTP-PE).

LABEL: Murametide vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant made of murametide that has adjuvant activity similar to MDP.

LABEL: Murapalmitine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant called murapalmitine.

LABEL: D-Murapalmitine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that includes an MDP analog called D-Murapalmitine.

LABEL: NAGO vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is composed of neuraminidase-galactose oxidase (NAGO) a mixture of mixture of the two enzymes-neuraminidase and galactose oxidase.

LABEL: non-ionic surfactant vesicles vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant consisting of multi-lamellar vesicles comprising a mixture of non-ionic surfactant (e.g., 1-monopalmitoyl-rac-glycerol), cholesterol and dicetyl phosphate used as a primary vaccine adjuvant for entrapped antigen.

LABEL: PMMA vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant made from the emulsion polymerization of methyl methacrylate.

LABEL: protein cochleates vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant synthesized from stable protein phospholipid-calcium precipitates.

LABEL: QS-21 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A saponin vaccine adjuvant that is composed of extracts from the bark of the Quillaja saponaria Molina tree. Specifically, it is an acylated 3, 28-bisdesmodic triterpene glycosides (1,3) or "saponin"  with a molecular formula of C92O46H148 and molecular weight of 1990 Da. QS-21 is one of the active fractions of the bark of Chilean tree, Quillaja saponaria, purified using a reverse-phase chromatography (RP-HPLC).

LABEL: Rehydragel HPA vaccine adjuvant
definition: An aluminum vaccine adjuvant that is a synthetic oxyhydroxide of aluminum (aluminum hydroxide) prepared by acid-base precipitation.

LABEL: Rehydragel LV vaccine adjuvant
definition: An aluminum hydroxide vaccine adjuvant that is a low visosity aluminum hydroxide gel.

LABEL: Sclavo peptide vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that contains the 163-171 peptide of IL-1β.

LABEL: Specol vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant that is a water-in-oil emulsion that is used as an adjuvant and has immunostimulating properties similar to Freund's complete adjuvant (FCA).

LABEL: SPT (Antigen Formulation)
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant that is an emulsion of squalane (5%), Tween 80( 0.2%), Pluronic L121( 1.25%), phosphate-buffered saline pH 7.4, and antigen.

LABEL: stearyl tyrosine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant stearyl tyrosine is considered an "organic equivelant" of aluminum hydroxide.

LABEL: Theramide vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant called Theramide that is composed of N-acetylglucosaminyl-N-acetylinuramyl-L-Ala-D-isoGlu-L-Ala-dipalmitoxy propylamide (DTP-DPP).

LABEL: CRL1005 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is a copolymer (CRL1005), based on a 12 kDa polyoxypropylene (POP) core with 5% POE.

LABEL: nanoemulsion vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant and is made from non-toxic lipid droplets a few hundred nanometers in diameter and made from surfactants approved for human consumption and common food substances that are 'Generally Recognized as Safe' (GRAS) by the FDA.

LABEL: AS03 vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emusion vaccine adjuvant that contains alpha-tocopherol and squalene, two biodegradable polyprenyls, in an oil-in-water emulsion.

LABEL: LTR192G vaccine adjuvant
Parent: E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant
definition: An E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant that is a mutant form of E.coli heat-labile toxin.

LABEL: E. coli heat-labile toxin vaccine adjuvant
alternative label: E. coli heat-labile toxin, LT|LT Oral Adjuvant|LT-OA
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant containing E. coli heat-labile toxin.

LABEL: amorphous aluminum hydroxyphosphate sulfate adjuvant
definition: An aluminum vaccine adjuvant that is a a proprietary aluminum hydroxyphosphate sulfate formulation that is both physically and functionally distinct from traditional aluminum phosphate and aluminum hydroxide adjuvants.

LABEL: imiquimod vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant contiaing imiquimod a imidazoquinoline.

LABEL: resiquimod vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant, resiquimod is a chemical analog of imiquimod.

LABEL: AF03 vaccine adjuvant
definition: An emulsion vaccine adjuvant containing 2.5% squalene.

LABEL: Flagellin vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant composed of flagellin from gram-negative bacteria.

LABEL: poly(I:C) vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant containing Poly(I:C), a synthetic double stranded analog of RNA.

LABEL: ISCOMATRIX vaccine adjuvant
Parent: particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant
definition: A particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant that is a vaccine adjuvant comprising cholesterol, phospholipid and saponin but without antigen.
editor note: ISCOMATRIX is identical to ISCOMs except that it does not contain antigen. Ref: PMID: 17336431.

LABEL: Abisco-100 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A saponin vaccine adjuvant that is made from highly purified saponins.

LABEL: albumin-heparin microparticles vaccine adjuvant
Parent: particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant
definition: A particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant  that is albumin-heparin microparticles vaccine adjuvant that is prepared from albumin and heparin stabilized by cross-linking reaction with EDC.

LABEL: AS-2 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A combination vaccine adjuvant and is based on the combination of Monophosphoryl Lipid A(MPL), QS21 (a purified fraction of Saponin extracted from Quillarja Saponaria), and a proprietary oil in water emulsion.

LABEL: B7-2 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that includes B7-2.

LABEL: Bupivacaine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is a local anaesthetic drug belonging to the amino amide group, and is used as a vaccine adjuvant in DNA vaccines.

LABEL: cationic liposome-DNA complex JVRS-100 vaccin adjuvant
definition: A liposome-based vaccine adjuvant that is composed of virus sized liposomes that contain a DNA plasmid.

LABEL: DHEA vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is DHEA, which is relatively stable and can be directly incorporated into vaccine formulations.

LABEL: DL-PGL (Polyester poly (DL-lactide-co-glycolide)) vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is PLGA, which has been used in the controlled delivery of peptide drugs.

LABEL: IL-15 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that uses the adjuvant effect of cytokine IL-15.

LABEL: immunoliposomes containing antibodies to costimulatory molecules
definition: A liposome-based vaccine adjuvant which is prepared from dehydration-rehydration vesicles (DRVs).

LABEL: LTK72 vaccine adjuvant
Parent: E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant
definition: An E. coli LT toxin derived vaccine adjuvant that is a mutant form of heat-labile Escherichia coli enterotoxin (LT) that contains a substitution Ala -> Arg  in position 72 of the A subunit.

LABEL: MPL-SE vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant containing MPL and squalene.

LABEL: non-toxic mutant E112K of Cholera Toxin mCT-E112K vaccine adjuvant
alternative label: mCT|non-toxic mutant E112K of Cholera Toxin mCT-E112K
definition: A microbial derived vaccine adjuvant made of E112K mC,  a mutated CT created by substituting a single amino acid in the ADP-ribosyltransferase active centre, glutamate to lysine at position 112.

LABEL: cholera toxin derived vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant that is derived from cholera toxin.

LABEL: SAF-1 vaccine adjuvant
definition: A combination vaccine adjuvant that is composed of threonyl-MDP (0.05-1%) in an emulsion vehicle [5% squalane, 2.5% Pluronic(R) L121, 0.2% Polysorbate 80 and phosphate buffered saline (pH 7.4)].

LABEL: Sendai Proteoliposomes, Sendai-containing Lipid Matrices
definition: A liposome-based vaccine adjuvant that includes the glycoproteins of Sendai virus.

LABEL: threonyl muramyl dipeptide (TMDP) vaccine adjuvant
definition: A synthetic vaccine adjuvant that is threonyl muramyl dipeptide (TMDP).

LABEL: ty particles vaccine adjuvant
definition: A microbial derivative vaccine adjuvant made of virus like particles (VLPS) containing the yeast retrotransposon Ty which has the amino acids 1-381 of the pI protein encoded.

LABEL: cytokine vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that contains active cytokine compound.

LABEL: combination vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that is composed of differnt compounds under more than one category.

LABEL: particulate antigen delivery system vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that serves as a particulate antigen delivery system.

LABEL: synthetic vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that contains synthetic material.

LABEL: tensoactive compound vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that includes tensioactive material. Tensioactive materials, surfactants or active surface agents are chemical substances with a polar-non polar structure. These substances have a tendency to locate themselves at the surface creating an adsorbed monomolecular layer on the interface.

LABEL: carbohydrate vaccine adjuvant
definition: A vaccine adjuvant that is primarily composed of carbohydrates.

LABEL: IFN-gamma vaccine adjuvant
definition: A cytokine vaccine adjuvant that includes IFN-gamma.

LABEL: ISS 1018 CpG ODN vaccine adjuvant
definition: A CpG DNA vaccine adjuvant that is a short, synthetic, unmethylated CpG oligodeoxynucleotide (CpG ODN) with immunostimulatory activity.
editor note: ISS 1018 is a short, synthetic, unmethylated CpG oligodeoxynucleotide (CpG ODN) with immunostimulatory activity. ISS 1018 signals through Toll-like receptor 9 (TLR9) to induce the production of immunoglobulin by B cells and interferon (IFN) -alpha, IFN-beta, interleukin-12 (IL-12), and tumor necrosis factor - alpha (TNF-alpha) by plasmacytoid dendritic cells (pDC). ISS 1018 CpG ODN promotes antigen presentation and co-stimulatory molecule expression. ISS 1018 is currently being investigated in combination with HBsAg vaccine as a prophylactic treatment for to prevent Hepatitis B in adults. It is also being investigated in combination with rituximab for treatment of b-cell or non-hodgkin's lymphoma.

LABEL: Matrix-M vaccine adjuvant
definition: A saponin vaccine adjuvant comprised of 40 nm nanoparticles composed of Quillaja saponins, cholesterol and phospholipid.

LABEL: Advax vaccine adjuvant
